body:
Hm, I think the `tbats` package that we interface does not have an updating capability, therefore the `sktime` `update` defaults to refitting.
I've opened an issue on `tbats` here: https://github.com/intive-DataScience/tbats/issues/35

If you want to control how often you refit, you can use the wrappers in the `forecasting.stream` module that will be added with 0.13.1 (you can try them out on the dev version), feedback appreciated. Note that this will still refit, but you can say sth like "I want to refit only every month".

issue.title: [ENH] Implement update method for AutoETS

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
In relation to #3063 and #3064.

`AutoETS` - as a forecaster with autotuning capabilities such as `AutoARIMA` and `TBATS` - should ideally have a dedicated `update` method, which allows updating the model coefficients, without retuning the model hyperparameters when `AutoETS(auto=True)`. This would enable the user to separate hyperparameter tuning from updating/fitting the best forecaster selected by `AutoETS`. Default as of now should be full refit.

body: Thank you @fkiraly. I definitely have what I need now to use this functionality! Might be worth implementing a similar ‘update’ wrapper method to that used for other sktime models. Especially given the ‘refit_model.py’ logic is short and self-contained. Let me know if you’d like me to create a PR for this? Regardless really appreciate the follow up.

>Especially given the ‘refit_model.py’ logic is short and self-contained.

Which `refit_model.py` are you referring to?

> Let me know if you’d like me to create a PR for this? Regardless really appreciate the follow up.

Sure, would be appreciated! What precisely would you like to implement?

Oh, in the TBATS repository, I get it.

Yes, would appreciate a PR! If you need access to the pooled data, the `self._y` attribute stores the updated `y`.

Perfect, can do. I tried creating a branch with my update and pushing it to the repo (from which I’d create a PR for your review) but it looks like I’d need to be granted some access permissions. Can you help or do I need to do a bunch of required onboarding?

Sent from my iPhone 

> Le 21 juil. 2022 à 9:28 PM, Franz Király ***@***.***> a écrit :
> 
> ﻿
> Oh, in the TBATS repository, I get it.
> 
> Yes, would appreciate a PR! If you need access to the pooled data, the self._y attribute stores the updated y.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or unsubscribe.
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.

>Perfect, can do. I tried creating a branch with my update and pushing it to the repo (from which I’d create a PR for your review) but it looks like I’d need to be granted some access permissions. Can you help or do I need to do a bunch of required onboarding?

Only core devs can push directly to this repo, you need to fork and make a PR from your fork.
(this is the typical open source contribution workflow, so once you've seen it you know it)
Instructions here: https://www.sktime.org/en/stable/developer_guide/git_workflow.html
Thanks @fkiraly, makes sense. This is my first time contributing to a public repo. Ill have a read through the link and give it a go later today!

issue.title: [ENH] dedicated `_update` for `BATS` and `TBATS`

labels.name: interfacing algorithms
labels.description: Interfacing existing algorithms/estimators for other packages

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
…r BATS and TBATS wrappers

#### Reference Issues/PRs
Fixes #3063. See also https://github.com/intive-DataScience/tbats/issues/35 for discussion. 

#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
Implements update method for tbats, which allows users to update state fo the model with new observations (fast) without refitting model parameters (slow). Particualrly, useful for walk-forward prediction and validation.

#### Does your contribution introduce a new dependency? If yes, which one?
No new dependencies were introduced.


#### What should a reviewer concentrate their feedback on?
There are a number of potential places I could implement this change. I thought the _tbats.py file with the adapter class was the most natural but let me know if this was not the intended design / pattern. 

#### Any other comments?
This is my first contribution to a public code base. Would appreciate any feedback and, if happy, would be interested in contributing more (eg. related issues #3064 and #3065).
